name.pehl.gwt.piriti.rebind
Class FieldHandlerRegistry

java.lang.Object
  name.pehl.gwt.piriti.rebind.FieldHandlerRegistry

public class FieldHandlerRegistry
extends Object

Registry which maps classnames to FieldHandlers. This registry is used by the XmlReaderCreator when generating code.

Version:
$LastChangedRevision: 60 $
Author:
$LastChangedBy: harald.pehl $

Constructor Detail

FieldHandlerRegistry

public FieldHandlerRegistry()
Construct a new instance of this class and registeres the initial field handlers.

Method Detail

registerInitialFieldHandlers

protected void registerInitialFieldHandlers()
Registers the initial field handler used in piriti. The following handlers are registered:
  • DefaultFieldHandler
    • Boolean.class.getName()
    • Byte.class.getName()
    • Character.class.getName()
    • Date.class.getName()
    • Double.class.getName()
    • Float.class.getName()
    • Integer.class.getName()
    • Long.class.getName()
    • Short.class.getName()
  • StringFieldHandler
    • String.class.getName()
  • CollectionFieldHandler
    • Collection.class.getName()
    • List.class.getName()
    • ArrayList.class.getName()
    • LinkedList.class.getName()
    • Set.class.getName()
    • HashSet.class.getName()
    • SortedSet.class.getName()
    • TreeSet.class.getName()

findFieldHandler

public FieldHandler findFieldHandler(FieldContext fieldContext)
Looks up a field handler based on the information provided in the field context. The lookup logic is implemented like this:
  1. If the fields type is a primitive return the DefaultFieldHandler
  2. if the fields type is an enum return EnumFieldHandler
  3. If the fields type is an array return ArrayFieldHandler
  4. Try to lookup the field handler by the fields type classname (this will resolve all types registered in registerInitialFieldHandlers()
  5. If no field handler return XmlRegistryFieldHandler.

Parameters:
fieldContext -
Returns:
